div.l: And atte last the warden gaff hem leve
Iohn hiȝt the toon and Aleyn hiȝt the todir
Of oo town were they both that hiȝt strodir
Ferr in the north I know nat where
This Aleyn made redy al his geer
And vpon his hors the sak he lyfft a noon
Forth goith Aleyn and also Iohn
With swerd and bokeler by hir sidis
Iohn knew the wey hym nedith no gidis
And atte Mill the sakk they down leyde
Aleyn spak first Alheyll he seyd
How faris thy Feir douȝtir ⁊and thy wyff
Aleyn wel com quod Symond be my lyff
⁊And Iohn how now what do yee here
Be God quod Iohn nede hath no pere
Hym behovith to serve hym selff þat is no sweyn
Or els he is a fool as clerkis seyne
Our͗e mancipill I hope wol be dede
So workith ay the wongis in his hede
And therfor I am com and eke Aleyn
To grynd our corn and cari it home ageyn
I prey ȝew hiȝe vs hens as sone as yee may
It shall be doon quod Symkyn be my fey
What woll yee do whils it is in hond
Be God by the hoper woll I stond
Ȝit saw I nevir by my Fadir kyn
Be God quod Iohn how the corn goith in
Ne how the hepir waggith to ⁊and fro
Aleyn answerd Iohn wolt þow so
Then wol I be beneth be my crown̄
And see how the meele fallith down̄
In to the trowȝ that shall be my disporte
For Iohn in feith I may be of your sorte
I am as il a myllere as is yee
The myllere smylith at hir͗e nycete
And þouȝt al this is doon for a wyile
